data.title: Good food
data.text: Stopped by for breakfast with my husband, nice clean place. I had the shrimp enchiladas, they were delicious! My husband ordered the 7 mares and he said it was really good too, it certainly had a large quantity of food. Even though they were pretty full they were fast in getting the food out and the service was okay too.

data.title: Good stuff
data.text: My family and I definitely enjoy stopping in when we're in the mood for some authentic Mexican food. Their chavelas are one of the best ive ever had. Only downside is when they're really busy i feel the food lacks love.

data.title: food
data.text: the food was great and the employees were very helpful there was 30 of us but they didnt seem to mind

data.title: Very good mexican food
data.text: Dont let the looks deceive you. Good food, good service, reasonable pricing. Specialty items are micheladas, seafood coctails, tacos, and tortas.

data.title: real Mexican food
data.text: We discovered La Tapitio while staying at the the nearby City Center Motel (within walking distance). We were on our way north from our home in Mexico and we were pleasantly surprised to be 'back in Mexico' so quickly! Our server was super friendly even though she was learning english, no problema! They have a full selection of Mexican cervezas including my husband's favorite, negra modelo. Beer, chips and salsa arrived pronto. The food was really good, made from scratch, served hot and fresh. The place was hopping busy, a sure sign of good eats. I highly recommend it.

data.title: Great road-trip stop!
data.text:
My family and I stopped in here on a recent road trip, and I'm so glad we did. The food was delicious. I ordered a cheese enchiladas combo, which came with two enchiladas, rice, beans, a small salad, and a chunk of avocado (roughly 1/4 avocado), which most places would charge extra for. All of that was around $9, which is good value. I'm not sure what they did that made these enchiladas so different from other cheese enchiladas, but yum! Very tasty. 

The staff was quick, efficient, and friendly. They greeted us in Spanish and spoke English with me as needed. The restaurant and even the bathrooms were clean, which is always nice to see. The live music was a nice touch that my kid loved.

Definitely recommend and will be looking forward to visiting El Tapatio on my next trip along the I-10.

data.title: Not Spanish
data.text:
Don't be confused by the review, Dion.  This is not a Spanish restaurant although they speak both Spanish and English.

Had a very nice huevos rancheros breakfast with a very friendly and attentive waitress.  

Enjoy a very down home experience.

data.title: Amazing food!
data.text:
My uncle who lives in Indio recommended this restaurant and said it was where all the locals go. There are so many Mexican resturants here, we didn't have very high expectations... Man were we wrong!

This place is delicious!!! We tried the beef enchiladas, chile rellenos and sopa the legua, all of which were good! Even the agua de horchata was good! Not too sweet, but perfect! 

Service was good too. Waitresses took our order promptly and our food was ready within 15 mins. There is a large parking lot, so that wasn't a problem. 

Will definitely stop by again next time we are in Indio!

data.title: Great food/service
data.text: This is one of my favorite spots! Best chavelas in town and taco specials Monday thru Thursday. The environment is great and so is the food. Always fresh and tasty!

data.title: Group happy hour/dinner
data.text: My mom's friend recommended we try this place since she is spanish and can cook really well.  The food was just as she was hoping, fresh, reasonable, but tons of hot spices.  If they say hot or mild, that is what you get.  I like when a restaurant, especially mexican food, is the right temperature and not heart burn.
